I ran Malwarebytes after I installed XCOM and Malware.Packer.Gen on the D3DRM.DLL was the only thing that popped up in the file I downloaded. 

Once deleted, no problems. Full virus-scan showed nothing. Hopefully, removing the .DLL won't cause problems for those that remove it from the download.

Works great.Just read how to install that's listed by this torrent poster on the page.

PC specs: i5 2400, RAM 6GB, Radeon HD7850. On Win7 x64 launching XComGame.exe instantly crashes on kernelbase.dll.

People who dl'd skidrow's 5.45GB repack also had this error.

User bleh found out that they needed to rename some files in the install package. Not sure if this applies to KaOs' release too.

Welp nevermind my comment above. I installed it again manually (not through install.exe) and it works. Make sure to install the game in a short path (like on root drive backslash XCOM). Thanks for the release KaOs!

This upload made me stop using torrents. Download was nice and smooth but then I hit so many brick walls. Tried the installer first(Worst installer ever made) Then I tried manual install, Both failed. Found out certain files had missing pieces so I deleted this and rechecked torrent. Tried the installer yet again it did something different so I figured it was the corrupt files. When it was done I checked the directory(Default installer directory) and the ony thing in there was movie files. So I tried manual again and the same damn thing. I've tried every X COM torrent on TPB and they all give me problems not with the game itself but the installation process. Out of my 5 years of downloading torrents I've never had such a hard time. But still ty for the effort I just can't handle torrents anymore.
